Adam Lashinsky reports,`` Eric Schmidt also challenged the assertion that Google is locked in a competitive battle with Facebook.` We have a competitor called Microsoft,'' he said. Microsoft has more cash, more engineers, more global reach. We see competition from Microsoft every day.' `` Eric Schmidt also took on Google's competition with Apple. faces a similar quandary came out on top of other potential GOP presidential contenders in a straw poll conducted at the annual Values Voter Summit last year. The AP reported at the time: Mike Pence was the top choice for president with 24 percent of the vote. Former Arkansas Mike Huckabee , received 22 percent, followed by former Massachusetts Mike Huckabee Mitt Romney , former House Speaker Newt Gingrich and Palin. Palin was given the honors for vice president. She came in second behind Mike Pence

Muglia is just the latest in a raft of executive departures from Microsoft. In October 2010, Steve Ballmer announced the resignation of Chief Software Architect Ray Ozzie , who had helped shape the company's cloud strategy. The CSA role was unique, and I won't refill the role after Ray Ozzie 's departure, Steve Ballmer wrote in an Oct. 18 e-mail to the company.`` Following the natural transition time with his teams, but before he retires from Microsoft, Ray Ozzie will be focusing his efforts in the broader area of entertainment

down vital safety regulations, we need the airline industry to come to the table to ensure we have the greatest possible protections for airplane passengers,'' said Chuck Schumer , who was releasing letters to the FAA yesterday. The 51-year-old congressman's future has been the subject of speculation since he resigned the No. 3 GOP House leadership slot after easily winning in November for a sixth term from his eastern Indiana district. I am convinced he is now going to run for governor, said Mike McDaniel , a former state Republican chairman.
